questiontext.text: Which statement best describes the structure of the Functional Programming module?

generalfeedback.text: ✔ Knowing the structure of the module helps you plan your workload realistically across the semester.

answer.text: 14 weeks, with 12 weeks of tuition and a mix of lectures and labs

feedback.text: Correct. This structure allows concepts to be introduced gradually with plenty of hands‑on practice.
Incorrect. The module runs longer and includes labs as a core component.
Incorrect. Lectures are an important part of the learning approach.
Incorrect. Lectures guide the material that is practised in labs.

questiontext.text: Which statement correctly reflects the module policy on AI tools?

generalfeedback.text: ✔ This policy exists to help you use AI productively while still developing real understanding.

answer.text: AI tools may be used, but their use must be referenced and reflected upon

feedback.text: Correct. Transparency and understanding are essential and will be assessed later.

answer.text: AI tools are not allowed under any circumstances

feedback.text: Incorrect. AI tools are allowed, but only when used responsibly.

answer.text: AI tools may be used but must not be acknowledged

feedback.text: Incorrect. All AI use must be explicitly referenced.

answer.text: AI tools may replace understanding of the code

feedback.text: Incorrect. Understanding your own code is a core requirement of the module.
